intro: Dactyladenia mannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range from white to purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture, valued for its aesthetic appeal and ease of cultivation.
